document.title: Stillness in the Composition Classroom: Insight, Incubation, Improvisation, Flow, and Meditation
document.abstract: Studies of brain images provide scientific justification for encouraging meditation among young writers.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value:
Ryan Crawford Crawford is an MFA student and composition instructor at Southern Illinois University-Carbondale. He hopes to join the PhD program in Rhetoric and Composition in order to continue his research on the neuroscience of creativity and its applications in the FYC classroom. (r.d.craw@gmail.com)
Andreas Willhoff grew up in Sycamore, Illinois. He received a B.A. in Fiction Writing from Columbia College, Chicago and is currently pursuing a M.F.A in Creative Writing at Southern Illinois University. He plans on doing further research into how neuroscience can improve activities in the classroom. (andreas. willhoff@ gmail.com)
